repnme.cdata!:
Chad and Cameroon - Petroleum Development
            and Pipeline Project; Cameroon -  Petroleum Capacity
            Enhancement Project; Chad - Petroleum Sector Management
            Capacity-Building Project; and Chad - Petroleum Economy
            Management Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Petroleum Development
            and Pipeline Project for Chad and Cameroon are as follows:
            outcome was moderately satisfactory; risk to the development
            outcome was significant; Bank performance was moderately
            satisfactory; and Borrower performance was also moderately
            satisfactory. Ratings for the Petroleum Capacity Enhancement
            Project for Cameroon are as follows:  outcome was
            unsatisfactory; risk to the development outcome was
            significant; Bank performance was moderately satisfactory;
            and Borrower performance was o moderately unsatisfactory.
            Ratings for the Petroleum Sector Management
            Capacity-Building Project for Chad are as follows: outcome
            was unsatisfactory; risks to development outcome were high;
            Bank performance was moderately unsatisfactory; and Borrower
            performance was unsatisfactory. Ratings for the Petroleum
            Economy Management Project for Chad are as follows:  outcome
            was unsatisfactory; risks to development outcome were high;
            Bank performance was unsatisfactory; and Borrower
            performance was highly unsatisfactory. Some lessons learned
            included: it is imperative to design projects in light of
            the institutional and administrative capacity realities. In
            countries with weak capacity, it is important to focus on
            addressing the basic problems rather than attempting to
            introduce sophisticated practices. Paradoxically, major
            components of the program in effect assumed the existence of
            the very capacity they aimed to build. The temptation to put
            in place special mechanisms to protect specific resources
            and accomplish results is understandable in a weak capacity
            and governance environment, but institutional enclaves are
            generally not successful beyond the short term and even when
            successful in the short term they tend to undermine the
            already weak local systems and thus long-term development.

repnme.cdata!:
Chad and Cameroon - Petroleum Development
            and Pipeline Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Chad and Cameroon
            Petroleum Development Project were as follows: outcomes were
            satisfactory; sustainability was unlikely; institutional
            development impact was moderate; the Bank performance was
            satisfactory; and the Borrower performance was also
            satisfactory. Some lessons learned included: outsourcing of
            Bank supervision duties constituted an innovative feature of
            the project and was successful; the need to manage
            expectations with regards to the government's oil
            revenue estimates is essential; developing national
            expertise in the different facets of the oil industry
            (geology, geophysics, engineering, commercial, finance and
            economics, environment, and so on) is a daunting task;
            private partners may reasonably be asked, as they were in
            this case, to bear a share in the cost of mitigating the
            risks associated with insufficient country capacity;
            maintaining World Bank involvement and communications are
            vital; and finally, sustaining compliance with the
            environmental management plan needs better technical
            assistance from the Bank.

repnme.cdata!:
Chad-Cameroon Petroleum Development and
            Pipeline Project : overview

abstracts.cdata!:
This document has been prepared as a
            supplement to the Implementation Completion Report being
            submitted to the World Bank's Board of Directors. It
            provides an overview of the World Bank's support for
            the petroleum sector in Chad and Cameroon which included two
            IBRD loans to Chad and Cameroon for the main Petroleum
            Development and Pipeline Project in Chad and Cameroon and
            three IDA credits for capacity-building projects-one in
            Cameroon and two in Chad. It describes the context in which
            the projects were developed, the issues raised about World
            Bank participation, the development of the lending
            instruments used, the implementation of the projects
            (including monitoring), and the two investigations
            undertaken by the World Bank Inspection Panel. It also
            provides a description of civil society's contribution
            to the unique implementation arrangements and the lessons
            learned from the Project thus far.

repnme.cdata!:
Chad-Cameroon - Petroleum Development and
            Pipeline Project : report of visit to Chad by the
            International Advisory Group, December 5 to 21, 2003

abstracts.cdata!:
This report details the sixth statutory
            visit to Chad by the International Advisory Group (IAG) on
            the Chad-Cameroon Petroleum Development and Pipeline Project
            (IAG)  from December 5-21,2003. This sixth statutory visit
            to Chad took place five months after the beginning of oil
            production, and two months after the first exports from the
            offshore terminal off the Cameroonian coast. The mission
            focused on the state of preparation of the Government for
            managing and disbursing the oil revenues. It also continued
            its oversight of the effectiveness of monitoring by the
            Government agencies and examined progress in the various
            projects and instruments for local and regional development.
            Recommendations included the following: The oil company
            should adhere to the standards and practices in the
            operational phase; ensure that contractors and
            sub-contractors adhere strictly to the Environmental
            Management Plan; provide on-site supervisors needed
            information and training; minimize environmental impacts and
            disseminate information to the public about water quality
            management, waste management, dust control, drilling mud,
            soil restoration, worker health and hygiene, security and
            potential dangers, accidental oil spills, enclave zones
            studies, and business opportunities. Further recommendations
            were made involving the regional development plan,
            implementation of "emergency measures" projects,
            decentralization, and consultation with civil society organizations.

repnme.cdata!:
Chad - Petroleum Development and Pipeline
            Project : Management Response to Investigation Report

abstracts.cdata!:
The Management Response to the
            Inspection Panel Investigation Report responds to alleged
            claims that the Bank violated policies and procedures in
            regard to the Chad Petroleum and Development and Pipeline
            Project.  Management considered the findings of the Panel
            fully and developed concrete actions to address outstanding
            issues in regards to environmental assessment, economic
            analysis, poverty reduction, and the monitoring and
            supervision of projects. Management believes that the Bank
            has made exceptional efforts to apply its policies and
            procedures and to pursue concretely its mission statement in
            the context of the Chad Petroleum and Development and
            Pipeline Project. Given these actions, Management does not
            feel that, as a result, the Requestors' rights have
            been or will be directly or adversely affected by these
            Projects. Management remains committed to a process of
            regular consultation and disclosure to assure the
            environmental and social soundness of the Projects during implementation.

repnme.cdata!:
Chad - Petroleum Development and Pipeline
            Project : Investigation Report

abstracts.cdata!:
The Investigation Report of the Chad
            Petroleum and Development and Pipeline Project evaluates
            claims made by the Requesters in the Request for Inspection.
            The Request involved claims that the Bank violated several
            policies and procedures. The Investigation Report examined
            the relevant directives and policies that covered five
            different topics: environmental and social safeguards,
            economics, supervision, and information disclosure. The
            Panel examined not only for compliance with the Bank's
            policies and procedures, but also whether harm was done as a
            result of Management action or omission.

repnme.cdata!:
Chad - Petroleum Development and Pipeline
            Project : Investigation Report

abstracts.cdata!:
The Investigation Report of the Chad
            Petroleum and Development and Pipeline Project evaluates
            claims made by the Requesters in the Request for Inspection.
            The Request involved claims that the Bank violated several
            policies and procedures. The Investigation Report examined
            the relevant directives and policies that covered five
            different topics: environmental and social safeguards,
            economics, supervision, and information disclosure. The
            Panel examined not only for compliance with the Bank's
            policies and procedures, but also whether harm was done as a
            result of Management action or omission.

repnme.cdata!:
Chad - Petroleum Development and Pipeline
            Project : Eligibility Report

abstracts.cdata!:
The Eligibility Report for the Chad
            Petroleum and Development and Pipeline Project evaluates the
            claims of the Requesters regarding the Request that people
            in the area of the pipeline project have suffered
            environmentally as a result of the project and failures and
            omissions in the design, appraisal and supervision by the
            Bank. The Investigation Panel conducted an investigation
            into the claims at the relevant Project areas. After
            evaluating the situation and the Requesters, it was
            determined that the Requesters are eligible according to
            Bank specifications. The Eligibility Report advises that an
            Investigation in to the matters alleged take place.
